MiningTreasure.1001.2: As sand is brushed away, time stands still.
MiningTreasure.1002.2: Beneath its pure luster lies a heart of utmost sincerity.
MiningTreasure.1003.2: A frozen wave, a silent song of the ocean.
MiningTreasure.1201.2: A relic from an ancient kingdom, fragments of its iron-bound body now buried in the soil.
MiningTreasure.1202.2: A relic from an ancient kingdom. In the fine, intricate details of the gear, one can almost glimpse the brilliance of the civilization that forged it.
MiningTreasure.1203.2: The puppet-making craft has long been lost. But with a core like this, perhaps one day one could recreate it...
MiningTreasure.1301.2: A Ritual of Mysterious Origin: Tossing a coin into the greenhouse is said to boost the approval rate for project proposals.
MiningTreasure.1302.2: Coins just weren't enough anymore. Employees seem convinced that tossing larger bundles of cash guarantees their proposals will be accepted.
MiningTreasure.1303.2: Company Notice: Stop wasting money on superstitions. Buy some Pep Pep Juice and put in some honest overtime instead.
MiningTreasure.2001.2: The most adorable monster crystal in the world.
MiningTreasure.2002.2: A single drop grants understanding of all elvish tongues.
MiningTreasure.2003.2: The bearer of the scepter rides the waves and commands the shark packs.
MiningTreasure.2201.2: Once belonged to an adventurer, this lost item has been weathered by sun and wind, leaving the hands mottled with rust.
MiningTreasure.2202.2: Once belonged to an adventurer, this lost fragment bears only faint, worn traces of its original markings.
MiningTreasure.2203.2: Once belonged to an adventurer, this lost pocket watch is engraved with constellations across its dial. It is beautifully crafted and remarkably well preserved.
MiningTreasure.2301.2: A generic rock found all over the greenhouse. It's a notorious tripping hazard for employees rushing to clock in on time.
MiningTreasure.2302.2: An empty can tossed carelessly aside. The Greenhouse Manager has filed countless complaints about this litter.
MiningTreasure.2303.2: Announcement: Littering is strictly prohibited. It is everyone's duty to uphold the company's image.
MiningTreasure.3001.2: Beneath its filthy surface lurks unsettling secrets.
MiningTreasure.3002.2: Is it the source of all disasters or the dawn of supreme glory?
MiningTreasure.3003.2: Lost in the sea of time, it writes an eternal forbidden spell of the unknown.
MiningTreasure.3201.2: Rotten vines. Once useful for weaving tools, they are now fairly worthless.
MiningTreasure.3202.2: The remnant of a felled old tree. Once polished and painted, it can be used as garden or indoor decorative piece.
MiningTreasure.3203.2: A resin sphere with a butterfly inside it. Placed under light, it glows brilliantlyâ€”an artwork shaped entirely by nature.
MiningTreasure.3301.2: A key dropped by a careless employee. They used its loss as an excuse to play hooky the next day.
MiningTreasure.3302.2: An earth drill left behind by an absent-minded employee from R&D. The entire department tried to find it the next day but failed.
MiningTreasure.3303.2: A stake forgotten by a distracted Greenhouse Manager. The plant had somehow been propped up already the next day.
MiningTreasure.4001.2: Though coarse and heavy, it stands as the sturdiest fortress.
MiningTreasure.4002.2: The moment it sees daylight again, everyone is astonished by its crystalline brilliance.
MiningTreasure.4003.2: Legend says only those who vanquish the dragon are worthy of this extraordinary treasure.
MiningTreasure.4201.2: A bark torch soaked in resin, now too damp to serve its original purpose.
MiningTreasure.4202.2: The lantern's glass surface is covered in moss stains and cracks, but all it needs is a new wick to work again.
MiningTreasure.4203.2: A rare oil lamp said to burn for centuries. A true treasure for adventurers.
MiningTreasure.4301.2: A Greenhouse Ghost Story: In the dead of night, the sound of splashing water echoes from greenhouses that should be empty.
MiningTreasure.4302.2: A Greenhouse Ghost Story: In the dead of night, faint lights can be seen flickering inside greenhouses that should be empty.
MiningTreasure.4303.2: It turns out a Manager was just growing vegetables for their own table. They have since been publicly reprimanded.
